subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Jan Koum: From Food Stamps to WhatsApp Billions
description: A quick win: understand Jan Koum: From Food Stamps to WhatsApp Billions.

hook.text: Jan Koum signed the $19 billion Facebook acquisition deal at the welfare office where he once collected food stamps.

buildup.text: Koum immigrated from Ukraine at 16, sharing a two-bedroom apartment with his mother.

discovery.text: He hated advertising. WhatsApp was built on a simple principle: no ads, no gimmicks, just messaging.

twist.text: WhatsApp had 55 engineers serving 900 million users. The leanest team-to-user ratio in tech history.

climax.text: Facebook paid $19 billionâ€”$345 million per engineer. The biggest acquisition in tech.

punchline.text: The kid on food stamps built what a billion people use daily.

quiz.question: What principle guided WhatsApp's product development?
options: No ads, no gimmicksâ€”just simple, reliable messaging
Building the most feature-rich messaging app
